original: @200a * // gang gi tshe de de las yongs su nyams nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba dang / bsam gtan dang por skye ba mthong ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: @200a * // gang gi tshe de de las yongs su nyams nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba dang / bsam gtan dang por skye ba mthong ba de'i tshe na /
translated: When they fall from that state and are reborn in the desire realm or the first dhyƒÅna,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: they think:üîΩI have attained the state of an arhat.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do snyam nas de'i tshe 'jig rten dgra bcom pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa gang dag tshe 'di nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do snyam nas de'i tshe 'jig rten dgra bcom pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa gang dag tshe 'di nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te /
translated: They think, There are no arhats in the world, and at that time, there are no arhats in the world who have accomplished the state of an arhat and who, through their own superknowledge in this very life, have actualized and accomplished the world and the world beyond, and who declare:

original: bdag cag ni skye ba zad do //
analyzed: bdag cag ni skye ba zad do //
translated: Our births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
translated: We have lived the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: We have done what had to be done.üîΩWe will know no other existence than this.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa dag med do zhes de dag de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa dag med do zhes de dag de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
translated: They view and speak in this way.

original: ji ltar na byin pa la sogs pa med cing de dag med pa 'di la rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byin pa la sogs pa med cing de dag med pa 'di la rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: How is it that they do not have giving and so on, and what is the cause of their lack of giving and so on?

original: de'i phyir srog ni 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing de phyis chad par 'gyur zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog ni 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing de phyis chad par 'gyur zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they say, The life force exists in this life and is cut off and destroyed after death.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It does not occur after death.

original: gang gi phyir srog dag ni tshe 'di nyid la 'tsho bar 'dug cing srog de phyis 'jug tu shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis chad cing zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog dag ni tshe 'di nyid la 'tsho bar 'dug cing srog de phyis 'jug tu shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis chad cing zad par 'gyur la /
translated: Because life is sustained in this life, and that life is severed and exhausted by the nature of consciousness,

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis zhig cing chud za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis zhig cing chud za bar 'gyur te /
translated: and it is destroyed and exhausted by the nature of form.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu shes pa'i bdag nyid dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid gnyi ga chang par 'gyur zhing mi 'byung ba'am yang na bya bas chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu shes pa'i bdag nyid dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid gnyi ga chang par 'gyur zhing mi 'byung ba'am yang na bya bas chad par 'gyur la /
translated: After death, both the nature of consciousness and the nature of form are destroyed and do not arise, or else they are severed by action.

original: lus kyis zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyis zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: The body is destroyed.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu yang skye ba mi len pas mi 'byung ba de'i phyir byin pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu yang skye ba mi len pas mi 'byung ba de'i phyir byin pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since one does not take rebirth after death, it does not arise. Therefore, giving and so on do not exist.

original: 'o na de gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, where does it go?

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i lus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i lus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa yin te /
translated: The body of a person is derived from the four great elements.

original: de ni gang gi tshe dus byed pa ni de'i sa'i lus ni sa'i bag la zha /
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe dus byed pa ni de'i sa'i lus ni sa'i bag la zha /
translated: When it dies, its earth body is absorbed into earth,

original: chu'i lus ni chu'i /
analyzed: chu'i lus ni chu'i /
translated: its water body into water,

original: me'i lus ni me'i /
analyzed: me'i lus ni me'i /
translated: The body of fire dissolves into fire.üîΩThe body of wind dissolves into wind.üîΩThe body of space dissolves into space.

original: rlung gi lus ni rlung gi bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gi lus ni rlung gi bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of water dissolves into water.üîΩThe body of earth dissolves into earth.üîΩThe body of the elements dissolves into the elements.

original: dbang po rnams ni nam mkha'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni nam mkha'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of the senses dissolves into the senses.üîΩThe body of the mind dissolves into the mind.üîΩThe body of the aggregates dissolves into the aggregates.üîΩThe body of the sense organs dissolves into the sense organs.üîΩThe body of the sense objects dissolves into the sense objects.üîΩThe body of the sense consciousnesses dissolves into the sense consciousnesses.üîΩThe body of the five aggregates dissolves into the five aggregates.üîΩThe body of the four elements dissolves into the four elements.

original: skyes bu'i ro ni khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis khyer te /üîΩdur khrod du 'gro zhing bsregs phan chad mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i ro ni khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis khyer te / dur khrod du 'gro zhing bsregs phan chad mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of the six sense bases dissolves into the six sense bases.üîΩThe body of the six sense consciousnesses dissolves into the six sense consciousnesses.üîΩThe body of the eighteen elements dissolves into the eighteen elements.üîΩThe body of the twelve sense bases dissolves into the twelve sense bases.

original: bsreg bya dag ni thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsreg bya dag ni thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of the five aggregates dissolves into the five aggregates.üîΩThe body of the four elements dissolves into the four elements.üîΩThe body of the six sense bases dissolves into the six sense bases.üîΩThe body of the six sense consciousnesses dissolves into the six sense consciousnesses.

original: rus pa dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas so zhes bya bar smra ste /üîΩre zhig bdag ni chad par 'gyur na skyes bu'i lus 'di gar 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: rus pa dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas so zhes bya bar smra ste / re zhig bdag ni chad par 'gyur na skyes bu'i lus 'di gar 'gro zhe na /
translated: The body of the eighteen elements dissolves into the eighteen elements.üîΩThe body of the twelve sense bases dissolves into the twelve sense bases.üîΩThe body of the five aggregates dissolves into the five aggregates.üîΩThe body of the four elements dissolves into the four elements.üîΩThe body of the six sense bases dissolves into the six sense bases.üîΩThe body of the six sense consciousnesses dissolves into the six sense consciousnesses.

original: skyes bu'i lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi las 'dus byas @200b pa gang yin pa de ni 'chi ba'i dus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po'i bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi las 'dus byas @200b pa gang yin pa de ni 'chi ba'i dus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po'i bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of the eighteen elements dissolves into the eighteen elements.

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams ni nam mkha'i bag la zha bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams ni nam mkha'i bag la zha bar 'gyur te /
translated: The body of the twelve sense bases dissolves into the twelve sense bases.üîΩThe body of the five aggregates dissolves into the five aggregates.üîΩThe body of the four elements dissolves into the four elements.üîΩThe body of the six sense bases dissolves into the six sense bases.üîΩThe body of the six sense consciousnesses dissolves into the six sense consciousnesses.üîΩThe body of the eighteen elements dissolves into the eighteen elements.üîΩThe body of the twelve sense bases dissolves into the twelve sense bases.üîΩThe body of the five aggregates dissolves into the five aggregates.üîΩThe body of the four elements dissolves into the four elements.üîΩThe body of the six sense bases dissolves into the six sense

original: dbang po snang ba'i rang bzhin rnams rten gyi 'byung ba chen po dang bral ba na nam mkha'i khams gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su 'gro ste dper na shing ljon pa rdib pa na bya dag nam mkha' la 'gro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po snang ba'i rang bzhin rnams rten gyi 'byung ba chen po dang bral ba na nam mkha'i khams gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su 'gro ste dper na shing ljon pa rdib pa na bya dag nam mkha' la 'gro ba bzhin no //
translated: The faculties, which are by nature luminous, follow the luminous realm of space when they are separated from the great elements which are their support, just as birds fly away when the tree dries up.

original: ro ni ro gzhag pa'i khri dang de 'degs pa'i mi bzhi khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis khyer te dur khrod du mer bsregs phan chad mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro ni ro gzhag pa'i khri dang de 'degs pa'i mi bzhi khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis khyer te dur khrod du mer bsregs phan chad mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
translated: The corpse is carried to the cemetery on a bier by four men, or five if the bier is counted.

original: khrag dang sha la sogs pa bsreg bya dag ni thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩbsregs pa'i lhag ma so la sogs pa'i rus pa snum bag can dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas la /
analyzed: khrag dang sha la sogs pa bsreg bya dag ni thal bar 'gyur ro // bsregs pa'i lhag ma so la sogs pa'i rus pa snum bag can dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas la /
translated: The flesh, blood, etc., which are to be burned, are reduced to ashes.üîΩThe bones, which are not burned, remain, whitened,

original: snum bag med pa dag ni dung gi mdo 'dra bar gnas te /
analyzed: snum bag med pa dag ni dung gi mdo 'dra bar gnas te /
translated: and resemble a white tuft of wool.

original: skyes bu'i 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: Such is the destiny of human beings.

original: de lta bas na byed pa po dang / za ba po dang / shes pa po'i lus ni 'di nyid du zhig ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na byed pa po dang / za ba po dang / shes pa po'i lus ni 'di nyid du zhig ste /
translated: Therefore, the body of the agent, the experiencer, and the knower is destroyed in this life.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'gro bas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'gro bas /
translated: It does not go to another world.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu zab mo med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu zab mo med pas /
translated: Therefore, since there is no effect,

original: byin pa la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: byin pa la sogs pa med do //
translated: there is no giving, etc.

original: 'o na sbyin pa dang / len pa dag gsum dag bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'o na sbyin pa dang / len pa dag gsum dag bstan ce na /
translated: But if giving, etc., do not exist, why did the Blessed One teach three kinds of giving, three kinds of morality, and three kinds of patience?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩTherefore, the teaching of delusion is good, the teaching of the wise is good.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar rmongs pa nye bar stan pa ni sbyin pa la mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni legs so zhes bya ba smras te rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar rmongs pa nye bar stan pa ni sbyin pa la mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni legs so zhes bya ba smras te rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa'o //
translated: Delusion is stupidity.

original: nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang po 'ga' zhig gis sbyin pa byin cig ces nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang po 'ga' zhig gis sbyin pa byin cig ces nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: Teaching is the first teaching of giving by someone.

original: de ni rmongs pa yin pas dang po 'ga' zhig gis nye bar bstan pa'i dring 'jog cing mi phan bzhin du sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de ni rmongs pa yin pas dang po 'ga' zhig gis nye bar bstan pa'i dring 'jog cing mi phan bzhin du sbyin par byed do //
translated: Since it is delusion, one gives according to the first teaching by someone, even though it is not beneficial.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab can no //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab can no //
translated: The wise are those with wisdom.

original: nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang po 'ga' zhig gis long shig ces nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang po 'ga' zhig gis long shig ces nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are taught‚Äù means that some people initially teach them.

original: de ni mkhas pa yin pas dang po 'ga' zhi gis nye bar bstan pa rjes su 'brang zhing 'phral gyi thob rgyal gyis zug zug tu len par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni mkhas pa yin pas dang po 'ga' zhi gis nye bar bstan pa rjes su 'brang zhing 'phral gyi thob rgyal gyis zug zug tu len par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they are wise, they follow the initial teaching of some people and they do not accept them on the basis of their own whims.

original: 'o na yod par smra ba dag gis 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ma bstan nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yod par smra ba dag gis 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ma bstan nam zhe na /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the existence of other worlds and so on taught by the proponents of existence?

original: de la gang dag yod par smra ba de dag thams cad ni gsob gsog brdzun du smra ba dag yin no zhes bya bar smras te /
analyzed: de la gang dag yod par smra ba de dag thams cad ni gsob gsog brdzun du smra ba dag yin no zhes bya bar smras te /
translated: We say that all of the proponents of existence are liars and frauds.

original: yod par smra ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yod par smra'o //üîΩgsob @201a * //üîΩces bya ba ni brjod par bya bas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par smra ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yod par smra'o // gsob @201a * // ces bya ba ni brjod par bya bas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The proponents of existence are those who propound the existence of other worlds and so on.üîΩThey are frauds because they are empty of what they profess.

original: gsog ces bya ba ni dgos pa'i snying po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsog ces bya ba ni dgos pa'i snying po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are liars because they lack the essence of a purpose.

original: brdzun zhes bya ba ni log par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun zhes bya ba ni log par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: False means that it is a distorted ideation.

original: 'o na de ltar mdzangs ngan la sogs pa med dam zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir 'di ltar byis pa dang mkhas pa de nyid ni phyis chad par 'gyur zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar mdzangs ngan la sogs pa med dam zhe na / de'i phyir 'di ltar byis pa dang mkhas pa de nyid ni phyis chad par 'gyur zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, then are there no wise and foolish people, etc.?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The wise and the foolish are annihilated and destroyed after death.

original: chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Annihilation means that they abide in the intermediate existence.

original: zhig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dus snga ma'i srid pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dus snga ma'i srid pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Destruction means that they abide in the prior existence.

original: mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Non-arising means that they abide in the existence at birth.

original: de ltar lta ba 'di dag ni chad par lta ba'i log pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba 'di dag ni chad par lta ba'i log pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: These views are the distorted nature of the view of annihilation and are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origination.

original: 'di'i kun nas slong ba ni bye brag ba'i gzhung las mu stegs can chad par smra ba lta ba dag la lta ba'i rnam pa 'di 'byung bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'di'i kun nas slong ba ni bye brag ba'i gzhung las mu stegs can chad par smra ba lta ba dag la lta ba'i rnam pa 'di 'byung bar brjod do //
translated: This view arises in tƒ´rthikas who propound annihilation.

original: de dag yang 'byung ba'i srid pa ni med de /üîΩmngal na gnas pa'i skye ba'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: de dag yang 'byung ba'i srid pa ni med de / mngal na gnas pa'i skye ba'i dngos po yin /
translated: They do not have any existence that arises again,üîΩbecause they view the state of birth in the womb as the end of birth.

original: 'chi ba ni skye ba'i tha ma yin par lta bas de dag la yang 'byung ba'i srid par phan par byed pa'i sems brtas par mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'chi ba ni skye ba'i tha ma yin par lta bas de dag la yang 'byung ba'i srid par phan par byed pa'i sems brtas par mi byed cing /
translated: Therefore, they do not strengthen the mind that would help them to have a rebirth.üîΩThey think that sentient beings do not have a future life.

original: sems can rnams kyi tshe phyi ma med par sems pas de'i phyir srog ni 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing /üîΩde phyis chad par 'gyur zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi tshe phyi ma med par sems pas de'i phyir srog ni 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing / de phyis chad par 'gyur zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they think that life ends with this life.üîΩThey think that after death, one does not arise again.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
translated: They think and say that this is the way it is.

original: lam gol bar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i shes pa spangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lam gol bar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i shes pa spangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are said to have entered a false path because they have abandoned correct knowledge.

original: lam ngan pa legs par sgrub ces bya ba ni lam log pa lus dang ngag gnyis kyi rjes su sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam ngan pa legs par sgrub ces bya ba ni lam log pa lus dang ngag gnyis kyi rjes su sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who practices a bad path well‚Äù means one who practices a wrong path, following after body and speech.

original: lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni der song nas 'jigs pa dang phrad par 'gyur bas lam de snga nas spang bar bya dgos pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni der song nas 'jigs pa dang phrad par 'gyur bas lam de snga nas spang bar bya dgos pa bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like a fearful path‚Äù means that, having gone there, one will encounter fear, so that path must be abandoned beforehand.

original: blo ngan zhes bya ba ni shes pa ste nang gi de kho na nyid kyis so //
analyzed: blo ngan zhes bya ba ni shes pa ste nang gi de kho na nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúEvil mind‚Äù refers to consciousness, by means of inner reality.

original: log par ston byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gis te /
analyzed: log par ston byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gis te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who teaches falsely‚Äù refers to words.

original: gzhan la ston pas so //
analyzed: gzhan la ston pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who teaches others‚Äù refers to teaching others.

original: dman pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInferior‚Äù refers to the childish.

original: ston par grags pa ste zhes bya ba ni ston pa ma yin par ston par grags pa'o //
analyzed: ston par grags pa ste zhes bya ba ni ston pa ma yin par ston par grags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is known as a teacher‚Äù refers to one who is known as a teacher, but is not a teacher.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni ston pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni ston pa de'i 'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHis‚Äù refers to the teacher.

original: chos 'di ni de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid dang chad par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di ni de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid dang chad par lta ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis Dharma is like that‚Äù refers to the views of nonexistence and nihilism.

original: de yi chos min ci zhig 'dra //
analyzed: de yi chos min ci zhig 'dra //
translated: What is his Dharma like?

original: zhes bya ba ni chos de bas @201b ches dman pa'i chos ma yin pa med pa'i phyir de'i chos ma yin pa mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes smras pa zhes bya ba ni de skad ces nas smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos de bas @201b ches dman pa'i chos ma yin pa med pa'i phyir de'i chos ma yin pa mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes smras pa zhes bya ba ni de skad ces nas smras so //
